results.title: Coastwatch
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan, Don Scheldrup and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Australia has the largest accessible coastline in the world. The first line of defence is the coastwatch. The Fremantle class a fast all weather vessel has been introduced as the new type of patrol boat that will provide security for the nation.

results.title: Coastal dunes
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark, Granada Television International and Eric Harrison
results.brief_description: Uses an experimental approach to explain the process of saltation (sand movement) in a typical English coastal dune system. Also explains the interrelationships that exist between vegetation and soil type - the changing nature of these two elements is shown by a transect taken across a typical dune system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Spark, Granada Television International and Eric Harrison

results.title: Coals Coals (Horses and Carts)
results.creator_credit: Francis Gysin, National Coal Board and David Pitt
results.brief_description: The last of the horse-drawn delivery drays of Charringtons. The film is a nostalgic record of the work of the horses and delivery men. There is no glamour, the stables are scruffy, the men dirty, but the horses are immaculate. The title comes from a music-hall song which provides the background music.

results.title: Coal: the rock that burns
results.brief_description: Discusses the formation of coal, its location throughout the world, types of coal, mining, reclaiming stripminded land and the by-products of coal. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Coal valley
results.creator_credit: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Conon Fraser
results.brief_description: Presents the case for small scale private mining by examining the independence, ingenuity and engineering skill of the men who built and work five small privately owned coal mines on the west coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Conon Fraser

results.title: Coal Power
results.brief_description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. (12 min) “Demolition of Yallourn Briquette Chimney” looks at the demolition of the historic briquette production plant at yallourn. Directed by Jim Hayes. (4 min) “The Timeless Force” is a history of the harnessing of energy and its eventual application by the SEC. Gives a history of the SEC’s early years. This film narrated by John Stanton. (29 min)
results.description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. (12 min) “Demolition of Yallourn Briquette Chimney” looks at the demolition of the historic briquette production plant at yallourn. Directed by Jim Hayes. (4 min) “The Timeless Force” is a history of the harnessing of energy and its eventual application by the SEC. Gives a history of the SEC’s early years. This film narrated by John Stanton. (29 min)

results.title: Coal mining today
results.creator_credit: New Realm and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film showing how Britain trains young miners in the skills necessary for operating new coal-mining machinery. Also details the uses of coal.

results.title: Coal from Westland
results.brief_description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.
results.description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.
